immunity_markdown: cold, death effects, disease, paralyzed, poison, unconscious
markdown:
<title level="1" pfs="Standard">[Skulltaker](/Monsters.aspx?ID=377)</title>

<row gap="medium">

<column gap="medium" flex="1 1 400px">

Swirling down from misty peaks and through howling mountain passes like an evil wind, the vortex of bones known as a skulltaker is a terrible manifestation of the delirium and agony experienced by doomed climbers and lost trailblazers just before they met their end. In some places, a skulltaker is also known as a saxra.

<column gap="tiny">
**[Recall Knowledge - Undead](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**
([Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13)): DC 40

**[Unspecific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 38

**[Specific Lore](/Rules.aspx?ID=563)**: DC 35
</column>

</column>

<column gap="medium">
<image src="/images/Monsters/Skulltaker.png" />
</column>

</row>

<title level="2" right="Creature 18">[Skulltaker](/Monsters.aspx?ID=377)</title>

<traits>
<trait label="Uncommon" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=159" />
<trait label="NE" url="/Rules.aspx?ID=95" />
<trait label="Huge" />
<trait label="Undead" url="/Traits.aspx?ID=160" />
</traits>

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="tiny">**Source** [Bestiary](/Sources.aspx?ID=2) pg. 300</row>

**Perception** +33; darkvision, [_true seeing_](/Spells.aspx?ID=344)

**Languages**
[Necril](/Languages.aspx?ID=20); Skeletal Lore languages

**Skills**
[Acrobatics](/Skills.aspx?ID=1) +34, [Intimidation](/Skills.aspx?ID=7) +35, [Religion](/Skills.aspx?ID=13) +30, [Skeletal Lore](/Skills.aspx?ID=8) +30, [Stealth](/Skills.aspx?ID=15) +32

<row gap="medium">
**Str** +8

**Dex** +6

**Con** +6

**Int** +2

**Wis** +8

**Cha** +7
</row>

**Skeletal Lore** ([divination](/Traits.aspx?ID=47), [divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48)) A skulltaker taps into the memories of the creatures whose bones make up its body. This gives it the Skeletal Lore skill, which it can use to Recall Knowledge of any kind. In addition, it can speak and understand all the languages known by the creatures whose bones make up its body (typically including Common and the regional language of the skulltaker's home region). The skulltaker can use Skeletal Lore as the primary skill check for the legend lore ritual, and it can cast legend lore without secondary casters.

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

<row gap="medium">
**AC** 42 

**Fort** +31 

**Ref** +33 

**Will** +35 

+1 status to all saves vs. positive
</row>

**HP** 300

**Immunities**
cold, death effects, disease, paralyzed, poison, unconscious

**Resistances**
piercing 15, slashing 15

**Shard Storm** ([air](/Traits.aspx?ID=5), [aura](/Traits.aspx?ID=206), [divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [necromancy](/Traits.aspx?ID=117)) 10 feet. A cloud of bone shards surrounds the skulltaker. When a creature moves into the emanation or begins its turn there, shard storm attempts to counteract any death ward effect on the creature (+30 counteract modifier) and then deals 4d6 slashing damage and 4d6 negative damage to the creature, with a DC 40 basic Reflex save.

</column>

---

<column gap="tiny">

**Speed** 30 feet, fly 60 feet

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
jaws +35 ([deadly 2d12](/Traits.aspx?ID=174), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 10 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)),
**Damage** 3d10+14 piercing plus 3d6 negative and energy drain

**Melee**
<actions string="Single Action" />
claw +35 ([Agile](/Traits.aspx?ID=170), [deadly 2d12](/Traits.aspx?ID=174), [Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [reach 15 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=192)),
**Damage** 3d6+14 slashing plus 3d6 negative and energy drain

**Ranged**
<actions string="Single Action" />
bone javelin +33 ([Magical](/Traits.aspx?ID=103), [thrown 100 feet](/Traits.aspx?ID=195)),
**Damage** 3d8+6 piercing plus 3d6 negative

**Divine Innate Spells** DC 40
- **8th**
[Finger of Death](/Spells.aspx?ID=116) (x2), [Horrid Wilting](/Spells.aspx?ID=152) (x2), [Punishing Winds](/Spells.aspx?ID=240) (x2)
- **Constant (6th)**
[True Seeing](/Spells.aspx?ID=344)

**Divine Rituals** DC 40

- **7th**
[Legend Lore](/Rituals.aspx?ID=15)

**Bonetaker**  ([Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Necromancy](/Traits.aspx?ID=117)) Whenever a creature dies within 60 feet of a skulltaker, the skulltaker draws a portion of the creature’s bones into its shard storm. The creature must succeed at a DC 40 Will save or rise as a _[skeletal champion](/Monsters.aspx?ID=373)_ in 1d4 rounds. These skeletal champions are controlled by the skulltaker.

**Energy Drain**  ([Divine](/Traits.aspx?ID=48), [Necromancy](/Traits.aspx?ID=117)) When a skulltaker hits with a melee Strike, the target must succeed at a DC 40 Fortitude save or become drained 2 and doomed 1.

**Splintered Ground** <actions string="Single Action" />  The skulltaker causes splintered bones to erupt from all solid surfaces in a 100-foot emanation, except for surfaces of worked stone. A creature moving through the bones takes 10 piercing damage and 10 negative damage for every 5 feet of movement. The first time each round a creature takes piercing damage from these splintered bones, it must succeed at a Reflex save or take a –10-foot circumstance penalty to all Speeds for 10 minutes, or a –15-foot circumstance penalty for 24 hours on a critical failure. The bones remain in place until the skulltaker uses this action again or the bones are manually removed, which takes 10 minutes for each 5-foot square.

</column>

<aside>
<title level="2" noclass="true" icon="/images/Icons/Sidebar_2_AdditionalLore.png">Skulltaker Insight</title>

The cooperation of a skulltaker is a powerful asset, for this whirling mass of death knows the collective memories of the creatures whose bones form its body. Because mountain travelers come from far and wide, the breadth of a skulltaker’s knowledge is often vast, spanning a range of topics.
</aside>
name: Skulltaker
